Acne.overview: Common inflammatory condition with comedones, papules, or pustules.
precautions: Keep hair products off the face
care: Over-the-counter benzoyl peroxide or salicylic acid

Carcinoma.overview: Type of skin cancer, often presenting as non-healing sores, red patches, or growths.

Eczema.overview: Chronic itchy dermatitis with dry, inflamed patches.

Keratosis.overview: Rough, scaly patches of skin caused by excessive keratin buildup (may be actinic or seborrheic).
care: Moisturizers or keratolytic creams (urea, salicylic acid)
Cryotherapy, curettage, or laser under dermatologist

Milia.overview: Small, white cysts formed when keratin is trapped beneath the skin surface.

Rosacea.overview: Chronic skin condition causing redness, flushing, and sometimes pimples on the face.
precautions: Avoid known triggers (spicy food, alcohol, sun, stress)
care: Topical metronidazole, azelaic acid, or ivermectin (doctor prescribed)
Laser therapy for visible blood vessels
